channel.title: Demographics on Quixotic Quant
channel.description: Recent content in Demographics on Quixotic Quant

item.title: The Missing Million
item.description: Imagine that one of the most important graphs for economic and policy planning was wrong. I mean seriously wrong. Wrong enough that any first-year stats student would fail their assignments if they presented it. Imagine that correcting its misuse might require statistically annihilating about a million people from Australia’s population. That’s the equivalent of the combined populations of Tasmania, the Northern Territory, and the ACT.
